title: Tata Motors shines in Q4, anticipates debt-free status; JLR posts record profit
description: Tata Motors Surpasses Expectations with Tripled Profit in Q4, Eyes Debt-Free Status. India's largest automaker reported a net profit of Rs 17,528 crore in Q4, thrice the previous year, aided by a deferred tax credit. The company's revenue for the period climbed 13% YoY to Rs 1.19 lakh crore. For the full FY24, Tata Motors delivered record profit and revenue, with JLR generating a net profit of Â£2.5 billion. The company continued deleveraging efforts, aiming for net automotive debt-free status in FY25. JLR expects consistent demand, though some stress is noted in the UK market.
